job_description:
In this role you will prepare financial analysis and reports for the NN Group Management board on business performance using Solvency-II (OCG), IFRS-17 and sales (VNB) metrics. In this very varied job, you will work on multiple projects enhancing insights to the financial performance of NN Group and their business units from a reporting as well as forecasting and business planning perspective.

The salary for this position is between € 4.332,- and € 6.189,- depending on your knowledge and experience. This is based on a 36-hour work week, excluding a 13th month and vacation pay.
Your impact as Financial Specialist Performance and Analytics at NN Group
The most exciting part of this job is de multi-scope role you will have, the insight you will have in all relevant financial impacts of the Group and the close contact with senior management. First and foremost, you are an financial specialist who will contribute to the analysis of the financial performance of NN Group both backward as forward looking. In addition, you are the advisor on financial and business related matters to the business units and relevant NN Group leadership. Your contributions to the financial performance reporting are of a high level, predominantly focused on key business drivers and mainly aimed to provide clear and actionable insights. All the while, you will play an important role in shaping the scope and implementation of IFRS17. For this part, you will write IFRS17 reports for senior management or analyze business units IFRS-17 reports. Moreover, you are writing internal IFRS-17 guidance (for instance Margin Analysis) and discuss IFRS-17 figures with business units.
Our Performance and Analytics team focuses on:
Drafting the Quarterly Performance Report in which business performance of all NN Group’s business units is discussed
Drafting the multi-year business plan for NN Group from an IFRS-17, Capital Generation and sales perspective
Analyze financial performance metrics and challenge business units on initiatives to improve performance (for example OCG, but also expenses)
Perform operational consolidation on the Solvency-II balance sheet of NN Group as well as analyzing operating capital generation (OCG)
Contribute to strategic projects of NN Group mainly from a financial point of view
Compare and report upon business performance compared to plan, past and forecast for both internal and external disclosure purposes
And we do a lot more, which gives you great opportunities to develop even further and have a very diversified role.
Your responsibilities
You will be business unit contact for one of the Dutch business units to understand and analyze the business and challenge on business driven actions to improve financial result
You will perform analysis on the financial result of NN Group and its business units to determine business driven actions for improvement
You will write financial reports for NN Group senior management on Solvency II (Operating Capital Generation), IFRS-17 both backward looking and forward looking
You will be involved in the IFRS-17 project to further implement IFRS-17
You will maintain and update Solvency-II consolidation tools together with the team members. In the quarterly reporting periods you are performing the consolidation of the Solvency II Balance Sheet and Own Capital Generation of NN Group
You will be involved in other projects. Examples of these projects are to draft the business plan for NN Group or to further improve management reporting processes
Your colleagues
You become part of our 12-person team Performance and Analytics. We are quite an international team with six different nationalities. In this role you will be part of the subteam focusing on NN Group and the Dutch business units consisting of 6 persons headed by the Manager Finance Business Performance.
Every Thursday, we work at the office; the other days you decide yourself, because that depends on your cooperation with other colleagues within NN.
The department Performance and Analytics is led by the Head of Performance & Analytics and directly reports to the Chief Financial Officer of NN Group.
Who you are
As a driven person, you have the mentality to get things done and to connect with others to succeed in your role. We can describe you as a team player who is able to collaborate effectively with both colleagues in (Group) Finance and Risk, colleagues in the Dutch business units as well as senior management. You also have:
An academic master’s degree in Econometrics, Actuarial Science, Finance or equivalent quantitative degree
A minimum of 4 years of experience gained insurance and experience in Solvency II and/or IFRS-17
Strong analytical and numerical skills to challenge and explain Solvency II and IFRS-17 results and identify business drivers
Excellent verbal and written communication skills (in English) and the ability to communicate with and report to senior stakeholders
Very good command of Excel
Continue developing
It is important to us that you continue to develop yourself. We give you the space and the confidence to grow in your career and as a person. We help you with:
Plenty of training and learning opportunities in our Learning & Development Centre
A large (international) network of colleagues who are keen to share their knowledge with you
The autonomy to steer your own development path
Employee benefits
You are more than a colleague, and that is something we understand very well at NN. You have many roles in life, leading to different choices. At NN we give you the opportunity to select employee benefits that are important to you. In consultation with your manager and your direct colleagues, you can work from any location at any time. You get enough flexibility to adjust your working pattern to your personal needs. In addition, you will receive:
Collective pension scheme with a personal contribution of only 6%
194.4 hours of leave, based on a 36-hour week (that’s 27 vacation days for a 5-day working week) and one Diversity Day
Holiday allowance and a 13th month paid with your monthly salary
NS Business Card 2nd class, giving you unlimited travel 7 days a week. Do you prefer to travel with your own transport? Then you can declare the kilometers travelled for business and commuting.
All NN colleagues work in a hybrid form: on average two days at the office and working from home (or anywhere else). The official location for this job is our fantastic office in The Hague. The office is located next to the A12, but is also easily accessible by public transport. Want to catch some fresh air? You can take the tram or bike and you will be at the beach in half an hour.
Will you be our new colleague?
We would like to invite you to have a cup of coffee or tea. Because we believe that your enthusiasm about this position will only increase during that conversation. So, what are you waiting for?
Apply now
If you have any questions about the vacancy you can reach out to Kamiel van Langen, Manager Performance & Analytics via 06 15416400. Any questions about the process can be directed to Joyce van der Burg, Recruiter via joyce.van.der.burg@nn-group.com

3 redenen waarom dit jouw baan is
Jij maakt van complexe vraagstukken concrete informatieproducten;
Jij bent een klantgerichte BI Developer met oplossingsvermogen en een nieuwsgierige instelling;
Jij wilt graag een bijdrage leveren aan een organisatie met een groot maatschappelijk belang.
Jij doet het
Als BI Developer werk je nauw samen met je stakeholders. Om snel en kort met de opdrachtgevers te kunnen schakelen wordt gebruikt gemaakt van de Agile werkwijze. De volgende werkzaamheden behoren tot jouw takenpakket:
Je ontsluit data middels de ETL tool ODI.
Je ontwikkelt robuuste data modellen in tabular model/SSAS.
Je bent verantwoordelijk voor het ontwerpen van dashboards samen met de stakeholders zodat zij effectief kunnen sturen op strategisch en tactisch niveau.
Je zorgt voor de onderhoudbare en beheersbare producten.
Je zorgt voor een geteste en gedocumenteerde oplossing.
Je ondersteunt gebruikers in het gebruik van de opgeleverde rapportages.
Je hebt focus op de continue verbetering van het product, het team en het proces.
Je weet het verschil te maken tussen wat de klant vraagt en wat de klant echt nodig heeft.
Je werkt aan de vulling en refinement van de product backlog samen met het ontwikkelteam en Product Owner.
Jij bent het
Je bent een proactieve BI Developer met een solide trackrecord binnen complexe en snel veranderende data omgevingen. Je weet de veranderende vraag van de business goed te doorgronden en te vertalen naar de meeste efficiënte oplossing. Dit resulteert in het ontwikkelen van een eindproduct dat precies aansluit bij de wensen van de eindgebruiker. Je bent een commutatief sterke teamspeler die zowel met de BI collega’s als met eindgebruikers goed kan schakelen. En je bent daarnaast altijd op zoek naar innovatieve BI methodes en oplossingen.
We gaan graag het gesprek met je aan als je:
Actuele kennis hebt van datamodellering (Stermodelleren, Data Vault);
Ervaring hebt met MS SQL/ Oracle SQL;
Minimaal over een afgeronde hbo-opleiding beschikt;
Vloeiend Nederlands spreekt en schrijft (fluency in Dutch is required for this position);
Beschikt over minimaal 3 tot 5 jaar aantoonbare Power BI ervaring;
Beschikt over minimaal 3 jaar aantoonbare ervaring als BI Developer;
Beschikt over ervaring met SSAS/Tabular Model;
Beschikt over ervaring met ETL tooling (ODI is een pre);
Kennis hebt van DAX.
Welke kansen bieden we jou?
Aan jou de taak om ze te pakken. Jouw uitdaging, balans en groei: het heeft onze aandacht. Kansen en mogelijkheden om te groeien als persoon en als professional zijn er genoeg. Bovendien kan jij (op basis van een 36-urige werkweek) ook rekenen op een modern arbeidsvoorwaardenpakket dat gericht is op eigen regie en keuzevrijheid met een bruto maandsalaris tot maximaal € 5.624,- (inschaling op basis van ervaring en geschiktheid).
Meer informatie over onze ijzersterke secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden (vergoedingen, pensioen en opleidingsbudget) vind je hier.

Jouw werkomgeving
Enthousiast geworden? Dat begrijpen wij! En dat vinden we ook belangrijk. Want het is wel de bedoeling dat je energie krijgt van je werk, zodat je samen met ons je voor de volle 100% inzet om onze 5,5 miljoen klanten elke dag een beetje beter te helpen. Zo kunnen we samen met onze ketenpartners onze maatschappelijke verantwoording nemen en onze bijdrage leveren aan de sociale zekerheid in Nederland.
De SVB werkt in opdracht van het Ministerie van SZW en VWS is in nauwe samenwerking met gemeenten en andere uitvoeringsorganisaties verantwoordelijk voor het uitvoeren van een groot aantal wetten in de zorg en de sociale zekerheid. Voorbeelden hiervan zijn AOW, Kinderbijslag, Vrijwillige verzekeringen, Wlz, WMO, Jeugdwet, etc.
Je komt te werken op de afdeling Service Center Data (SCD) van de directie Bedrijfsvoering in Amstelveen. Deze recent gestarte afdeling bestaat uit vier Multi Disciplinaire Clusters met voor ieder cluster een Product Owner (PO) en een Scrummaster (SM). In totaal bestaan de 4 clusters uit 6 teams met totaal 35-40 medewerkers. De 4 clusters zijn: het cluster Datakwaliteit, het cluster Data Analytics & Research , het cluster Stuur- en Verantwoordingsinformatie en het cluster DapPeR (infra, software en data handling).
Naast je thuiswerkplek zal je ook werkzaam zijn op ons kantoor in Amstelveen. Ons kantoor is goed bereikbaar met de auto en het openbaar vervoer. Wat je van jouw nieuwe werkplek kunt verwachten? Een open kantooromgeving en een moderne inrichting.
Thuis werken of op kantoor? Bij de SVB noemen we dit ‘Bewust Werken’. Dit gaat verder dan alleen een afweging maken tussen kantoor of thuis (hybride). Met Bewust Werken maak je in overleg met je team en leidinggevende een professionele en bewuste afweging over hoe, waar, wanneer, met wie en met welke middelen jij jouw resultaat optimaal kunt behalen, zowel kwantitatief als kwalitatief. Hierin staan niet alleen het klantbelang voorop, maar worden ook de belangen van onze organisatie, de teams en de medewerkers meegewogen. Er is geen dichtgetimmerd plan en we willen Bewust Werken realiseren door te experimenteren en te leren. Wanneer werken op locatie aan de orde is, is jouw werkplek Amstelveen.

Meer weten?
Wil je eerst nog meer informatie over de vacature of sollicitatieprocedure? Mail dan je vraag/vragen naar Anne Besselink (Business Partner Recruitment).

Solliciteren: jij pakt deze kans
Graag! Solliciteer en neem ons mee in je motivatie en overtuig ons vanuit je ervaring. Er is geen sluitingsdatum voor de vacature van BI Developer bij het Service Center Data (SCD), we informeren je zo snel mogelijk of (en zo ja: wanneer) we een kennismaking organiseren.
Iedereen verdient het om zich thuis te voelen bij de SVB. Divers samengestelde teams waar iedereen ertoe doet, maken ons effectiever, creatiever en verbetert onze dienstverlening. Onze doelgroep is immers ook divers. We verwelkomen medewerkers met een grote verscheidenheid aan achtergronden en perspectieven.

Opmerking acquisitie en VOG
Een achtergrondonderzoek voor start van de functie (VOG, geheimhoudingsverklaring en vragenlijst) maakt onderdeel uit van de procedure.
Een assessment kan onderdeel uitmaken van de procedure.
Acquisitie wordt voor deze vacature niet op prijs gesteld.

Director Strategic Engagement EMEA
Rotterdam (or another European Aon office) | 38,75
Aon Inpoint is a strategy advisory team dedicated to helping the global insurance industry. At Aon Inpoint we focus on advising (re-)insurers and capital partners generate tangible results by helping them identify opportunities and improve business performance.
We work with clients across P&C, H&B and Life, advising them across a broad range of challenges, from market entry, growth strategy, distribution effectiveness, operational improvement, M&A due diligence and post-merger integration.
Although Rotterdam is listed as the primary location, due to the international character of our work it is possible to fulfill this role from a other European Aon office.
Responsibilities
You will join the Aon Inpoint EMEA team as a Director. Your role will involve building strong and sustainable relationships with C-Suite client executives, leading the delivery of a range of advisory services to clients, managing account teams to develop strategic engagements taking responsibility for critical business functions.
As part of the Rotterdam team, you will be based in the EMEA hub of the Aon Inpoint business working with the most prestigious global players in helping them define their future.
Your responsibilities in this role will be:
Retain and build existing client relationships as well as actively seek new relationships and business development opportunities.
Being the focal contact point of your clients ( insurers / reinsurers ) and advocating their interest into the broader world of Aon
Ensure the smooth delivery of contractual obligations and day-to-day activities such as regular QBR’s and business reviews as well as following up on resulting actions
Engage with clients to identify their strategic needs and priorities and develop potential solutions.
Lead business development activities and collaborate with colleagues in the identification and creation of new sales / upsell opportunities.
Unlock potential bonus revenue opportunities and contribute as Subject Matter Expert to advisory projects delivered on behalf your clients
Structure and plan complex initiatives and identify and secure required resources.
Quickly and efficiently leverage a global network of people, best practices and Aon assets to generate compelling insights, analytics and strategic solutions.
Actively contribute to building of high performing teams, fostering a culture of development and learning to nurture talent.
Manage colleagues and support successful development of their careers.
Lead or contribute to Aon Inpoint brand development through industry relationship building, thought leadership, whitepapers, conferences and presentations.
Take responsibility for building and managing core business functions and capabilities.
Requirements
For this role we are looking for a senior professional in the international insurance sector who is able to be a sound sparring partner for both the internal as well as the external clients. Besides this you possess the following:
10-15 years of experience within the Insurance Sector with an (international) H&B background. Preferably time spent in commercial / technical role with a leading insurer and / or broker firm.
Solid understanding of H&B products, markets and players within EMEA
Proven track record and extensive experience in selling advisory and engagement services to clients, ideally in Financial Services sector, and managing complex international account teams.
Highly developed interpersonal skills – team leadership, relationship building, communication and international mindset.
Strong people manager – performance management and colleague development.
Accomplished communicator.
Demonstrates personal qualities of planning, commitment, resolving problems, decisiveness, and commitment to personal development.
Broad business acumen.
Demonstrable extensive experience in senior account management in an international environment.
Excellent oral and written communication skills in English and preferably another European language
Available and willing to travel frequently (approximately once every week)
Master’s degree or equivalent.
Waar kom je te werken?
Aon Inpoint
Created in 2008, Aon Inpoint has grown year on year to operate today with more than 300 people based in our offices in London, New York, Chicago, Miami, Rotterdam Singapore, Sydney, Dublin and Toronto. Our Rotterdam team is dynamic, international and enjoys close proximity to its client base on the European Continent and in London City.
The offer
At Aon we realize that no one is the same, which is why we offer a monthly flexible salary component (of 19,21% of your monthly salary) in addition to the fixed monthly salary. You can use this for a variety of purposes, including a gross payment, extra vacation days or extra pension.
In addition, we offer:
An attractive bonus scheme
A non-contributory pension
A sustainable employability budget
Flexible working hours and location
International career possibilities
More information?
Apply directly be using the ‘Apply Now’ button. We would like to receive your resumé and motivation.
For more information about the procedure or vacancy you can contact Jaco de Pee at jaco.de.pee@aon.com.
